title: Elected MPs

title: Elected MPs
text: package also contains functions represent election results graphically. first function presents overall count votes per party given year. example, 2013.  Parties can group together - .e. putting Coalition votes together  Furthermore, independents can individualised - instance 2022 elections:  Finally, also function plot historical seats per party
code: house_results_tally(2013) house_results_tally(2013, merge_parties = list(COAL=c("CLP","LP","LNP","NP"))) house_results_tally(2022,                      individualise_IND = TRUE,                     merge_parties = list(COAL=c("CLP","LP","LNP","NP"),                                          TEAL=c("IND-DANIEL","IND-RYAN",                                                 "IND-SCAMPS","IND-CHANEY",                                                 "IND-SPENDER","IND-STEGGALL",                                                 "IND-HAINES","IND-TINK")                                          )) house_results_historic(merge_parties = list(COAL=c("CLP","LP","LNP","NP")),                        parties =c("COAL","ALP","GRN"),                        include_other=TRUE)

title: House of Representatives - Get the data
text: function get_house_MPs() retrieves list elected candidates. Without parameters returns complete lists (divisions, elections), similarly previous functions allows results filtered divisions years
code: get_house_MPs(division = c("Melbourne","Cooper"),               year = c(2019,2022)) #> # A tibble: 4 × 9 #>    Year DivisionID DivisionNm StateAb CandidateID GivenNm Surname PartyNm                PartyAb #>   <dbl>      <int> <chr>      <chr>         <int> <chr>   <chr>   <chr>                  <chr>   #> 1  2022        320 Cooper     VIC           36384 Ged     KEARNEY Australian Labor Party ALP     #> 2  2022        228 Melbourne  VIC           36551 Adam    BANDT   The Greens             GRN     #> 3  2019        320 Cooper     VIC           32339 Ged     KEARNEY Australian Labor Party ALP     #> 4  2019        228 Melbourne  VIC           32423 Adam    BANDT   The Greens             GRN

title: House of Representatives - Preferences
text: get_house_preferences() - provides interface access preference flows particular division (electorate) given year, published AEC’s website . instance: Results can also retrieved disaggregated polling place: also possible filter Polling Place Name (PPNm source): Build top basic function, preference_flow_data() - provides interface access preference flows particular division (electorate) given year. function returns list, element data frame results counting round. basic use: function also include variables, better explained use part next function, house_preference_flow_plot().

text: Perhaps interesting see round counting assigns votes, candidate chosen. , , packages comes convenience function house_preference_flow_plot(), calls preference_flow_data() plot results alluvial format. Using previous example:  default vote present percentage, can changed changing value var:  analysis, may interesting remove parties initial round - e.g. see votes flow finalists. can done using exclude_parties:   Like plotting functions, possible override colour scheme providing additional named vector:  Similarly, possible get results house_preference_flow_plot() directly, via include_data:
code: house_preference_flow_plot(division = "Wills",year=2019) +   labs(title="Preference Flow for Wills, 2019") house_preference_flow_plot(division = "Wills",year=2019,var="Preference Count") +   labs(title="Preference Flow for Wills, 2019") house_preference_flow_plot(division = "Warringah",year=2022) +   labs(title="Preference Flow for Warringah, 2022") house_preference_flow_plot(division = "Warringah",year=2022, exclude_parties = c("LP","IND-STEGGALL")) +   labs(title="Flow of preference votes to Liberal and Teal in Warringah, 2022") #adding teal house_preference_flow_plot(division = "Warringah",year=2022,                       exclude_parties = c("LP","IND-STEGGALL"),                      extra_colours = c("IND-STEGGALL"="#008080")) +   labs(title="Flow of preference votes to Liberal and Teal in Warringah, 2022") p <- house_preference_flow_plot(division = "Warringah",year=2022,                       exclude_parties = c("LP","IND-STEGGALL"),                      extra_colours = c("IND-STEGGALL"="#008080"),                      include_data=TRUE                      )  p$source_data[[1]] #> # title: House of Representatives - Primary Vote
text: first plotting convenience function packages allows compare evolution primary voting across time. function relies house_primary_summary uses many options. ’s first use represent party trends one electorate:  many cases many minor parties, sometime useful just focus number parties. function allow filter number parties filtering voted certain year. cases possible consolidate others votes.  Finally, possible aggregate party acronyms - sometimes party changed named registered differently
code: house_primary_historic_plot("Canberra") house_primary_historic_plot("Canberra", parties =3,                              parties_year = 2022,                              include_others = TRUE ) house_primary_historic_plot(division="Brisbane",parties=5,                             merge_parties = list(LNP=c("LNP","LNQ","LP"),                                                  ON=c("HAN","ON")))

title: House of Representatives - Primary Vote
text: package also contains convenience function look primary vote results one division. Lile previous function, also inherits many attributes get_house_primary_vote.  plots can also displayed using bars, shown
code: house_primary_comparison_plot(division = "Kooyong", year=2022,individualise_IND = TRUE) house_primary_comparison_plot(state="TAS",year=2022,parties=c("LP"),plot_format = "bar")

title: auspol
text: auspol provides result data Australian Federal Elections, 2004 onwards, direclty R. Along functions access data, package also provides functions provide summaries tables plots. current version provides election data House Representatives. data contained release () Apache Parquet format, can used directly programming language/tool/platform supports Parquet.

title: auspol
text: First install required packages,, install package github Alternatively, install r-universe
code: devtools::install_github("carlosyanez/auspol") # Enable this universe options(repos = c(     carlosyanez = 'https://carlosyanez.r-universe.dev',     CRAN = 'https://cloud.r-project.org'))  # Install some packages install.packages('auspol')

code: house_primary_vote_summary(   division = NULL,   state = NULL,   year = NULL,   parties = NULL,   parties_year = NULL,   include_others = FALSE,   merge_parties = NULL,   include_informal = FALSE,   include_names = TRUE,   individualise_IND = FALSE,   wide_format = NULL )

title: Helper function to download  data — house_primary_vote_summary
text: division vector names electoral divisions (e.g. "Banks", "Wills","Indi") state divisions provide, provide vector state initials e.g. c("NT","TAS") year numeric vector election years (2004), defaults . parties parties include summary. (default), vector strings party acronyms (see list_parties()), number indicating top n parties certain year. parties_year parties NULL number, indicates selection needs certain year (.e.g select historical data three top parties 2012) include_others Boolean used along parties included remaining votes one "" category. merge_parties list parties merge one line following, format list(NEWCODE=c(code1,code2,etc.)) include_informal Boolean add informal votes addition party selection. Informal votes included parties selected, top n parties selected, happens top n - even flag set false. include_names whether include candidates name surname extract (TRUE default). individualise_IND set TRUE, party abbreviations independent candidate changed "IND" "IND-<<candidate's surname>>", effectively separating party aggregations. wide_format Whether present result long format, like AEC's source, year--year summary. Options include NULL (summarisation, default), "OrdinaryVotes" (absolute numbers), "Percentage_with_Informal"  "Percentage" (percentage counted elections).

title: Helper function to download  data — house_primary_vote_summary
